adjective.description: Having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do or achieve a specified thing.
examples: I'm quite capable of taking care of myself
the aircraft is capable of flying 5,000 miles nonstop
synonyms: be equal to the task of

adjective.description: Able to achieve efficiently whatever one has to do; competent.

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense able to take in, physically or mentally): from French, from late Latin capabilis, from Latin capere take or hold.
